title: 105_s1925
content:
The Act of August 9, 1955 is amended to authorize 99-year leases for lands held in trust for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon and the Cabazon Indian Reservation. SEC. 2 of the Grand Ronde Reservation Act is amended to increase the land acreage to 10,311.60 acres for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon. The Grand Ronde Reservation Act is amended to increase land acreage to 10,311.60 acres for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon. Lots 3, 4, SW\1/4\NE\1/4\, SE\1/4\NW\1/4\, E\1/2\SW\1/4\ are included in the amendment. The Grand Ronde Reservation Act is amended to increase land acreage to 10,311.60 acres for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon, including lots 3, 4, SW\1/4\NE\1/4\, SE\1/4\NW\1/4\, E\1/2\SW\1/4\. The land acreage for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon is increased to 10,311.60 acres, including various specified lots. The land acreage for the Confederated Tribes of the Grand Ronde Community of Oregon is increased to 10,311.60 acres, including specified lots in different sections. SEC. 3. SAN CARLOS APACHE WATER RIGHTS SETTLEMENT amended by striking ``subsections (c) and (d) of section 3704'' inserting ``section 3704(d)''.
SEC. 4. YUROK SETTLEMENT RECOGNITION. SEC. 4. YUROK SETTLEMENT RECOGNITION. Amends Public Law 98-458 to include distribution of funds based on specific court judgments in favor of individual Indians. SEC. 5 allows the Ponca Tribe of Nebraska to use funds from previous self-determination contracts to purchase or build health service facilities. SEC. 6 addresses the Navajo-Hopi land dispute settlement. SEC. 6 of the Navajo-Hopi Land Dispute Settlement Act is amended to clarify water rights on the disputed lands. SEC. 7 extends project terms under the Indian Health Care Improvement Act until October 1, 2002. Additional funding is authorized for fiscal years 2001 and 2002. Section 7(b) of the Coos, Lower Umpqua, and Siuslaw Restoration Act is amended to include a description of a parcel in Lane County, Oregon. This parcel is situated in section 23, township 18 south, range 12 west, of Willamette Meridian, and contains .062 of an acre. Additionally, SEC. 9 discusses a boundary adjustment for the Hoopa Valley Reservation. SEC. 9 amends the Hoopa Valley Reservation South Boundary Adjustment Act by changing degree measurements. SEC. 10 clarifies the service area for the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians of Oregon. Section 2 of the Act regarding the Confederated Tribes of Siletz Indians of Oregon is amended to expand their service area for Federal assistance programs to include several counties in Oregon. SEC. 11 of the Michigan Indian Land Claims Settlement Act is amended to address the treatment of funds for federal programs and benefits, as well as income taxes. SEC. 12 includes miscellaneous technical corrections. SEC. 12 makes miscellaneous technical corrections to the Indian Health Care Improvement Act and the Native American Housing Assistance and Self-Determination Act. SEC. 12 approves the transfer of water rights outlined in a stipulation and settlement agreement between the Jicarilla Apache Tribe and other parties. The approval will be effective upon the entry of a partial final decree by the court quantifying the tribe's reserved water rights claims. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Act of 1988 is amended to update eligibility requirements and terms and conditions for health care services. The changes include meeting specific requirements outlined in the Public Health Service Act. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Act of 1988 is amended to update eligibility requirements and terms for health care services. The scholarship assistance program covers primary health services as defined in section 12(8). Scholarship recipients must fulfill their obligated service through full-time practice in Native Hawaiian health care systems or health professional shortage areas. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Act of 1988 is amended to update eligibility requirements for health care services in Hawaii, including facilities in medically underserved areas. Scholarship recipients must practice in designated areas similar to health professional shortage areas. The Native Hawaiian Health Care Act of 1988 is amended to update eligibility requirements for health care services in Hawaii. Scholarship recipients are required to practice in designated areas similar to health professional shortage areas, with specific exemptions from certain Public Health Service Act requirements.
